events.originalText: LaMia Flight 2933 crashed near Medellín, Colombia, killing 71 people, many of whom were players from Chapecoense Football Club.
events.subtitle: LaMia Flight 2933
events.headline: LaMia Flight 2933 crashes near Medellín, Colombia, killing 71, including Chapecoense Football Club players

events.originalText: South African Airways Flight 295 suffered a catastrophic in-flight fire and crashed into the Indian Ocean east of Mauritius, killing all 159 people on board.
events.subtitle: South African Airways Flight 295
events.headline: South African Airways Flight 295 crashes into Indian Ocean, killing all 159 on board

events.originalText: Air New Zealand Flight 901 crashed into Antarctica's Mount Erebus, killing all 257 people on board.
events.subtitle: Mount Erebus disaster
events.headline: Air New Zealand Flight 901 crashes into Mount Erebus, Antarctica, killing all 257 on board

events.originalText: East Timor declared independence from Portugal.
events.subtitle: East Timor
events.headline: East Timor declares independence from Portugal

events.originalText: Jocelyn Bell Burnell noticed a "bit of scruff" in data from a radio telescope, which turned out to be from PSR B1919+21, the first discovered pulsar.
events.subtitle: Jocelyn Bell Burnell
events.headline: Jocelyn Bell Burnell discovers first pulsar, PSR B1919+21

events.originalText: In a military coup, Michel Micombero abolished the Burundian monarchy and declared the country a republic with himself as president.
events.subtitle: Michel Micombero
events.headline: Michel Micombero abolishes Burundian monarchy in military coup

events.originalText: Grand Ole Opry, the longest-running radio broadcast in the United States, first aired on WSM in Nashville, Tennessee.
events.subtitle: Grand Ole Opry
events.headline: Grand Ole Opry first airs on WSM in Nashville, Tennessee

events.originalText: At the All-Albanian Congress, the Assembly of Vlorë was constituted, which declared the independence of the Albanian Vilayet from the Ottoman Empire.
events.subtitle: All-Albanian Congress
events.headline: Assembly of Vlorë declares independence of Albanian Vilayet from Ottoman Empire

events.originalText: SS Petriana struck a reef near Point Nepean, leading to Australia's first major oil spill and a debate over the White Australia policy.
events.subtitle: SS Petriana
events.headline: SS Petriana oil spill near Point Nepean sparks debate over White Australia policy

events.originalText: The Chicago Times-Herald race, the first automobile race in the U.S., was held in Chicago.
events.subtitle: Chicago Times-Herald race
events.headline: Chicago Times-Herald holds first automobile race in the U.S.

events.originalText: Robert Boyle, John Wilkins, Christopher Wren and other leading scientists met at Gresham College in London to found a learned society, now known as the Royal Society.
events.subtitle: Robert Boyle
events.headline: Royal Society founded by Boyle, Wilkins, Wren, and others at Gresham College

events.originalText: Đại Việt emperor Lê Thánh Tông launched a military expedition against Champa, beginning the Champa–Đại Việt War.
events.subtitle: Đại Việt
events.headline: Đại Việt emperor Lê Thánh Tông launches military expedition against Champa

events.originalText: Having deserted the Ottoman army, Skanderbeg (pictured) arrived in the Albanian city of Krujë and, using a forged letter from Sultan Murad II to the governor of Krujë, became lord of the city.
events.subtitle: Ottoman Empire
events.headline: Skanderbeg becomes lord of Krujë after deserting Ottoman army
